file_content.text: Funny, people usually want to break out of prisons, not in to them. Guess everything's backwards with the Empire.
There was nothing discreet about this prison break. I expect more of the same blunt tactics inside.
We must be ready for anything, master. I sense chaos inside the prison.
It's going to be a free-for-all inside this prison. Unpredictable, volatile, desperate. I can't wait.
Prison riot. Shoot, first; toss grenades, second; call in an air strike, third--if anything's still moving, then ask questions.
Our claws go in clean, come out bloodied!
Our path is clear.
Nice demolition job. Can't run a prison with a big hole in the wall, huh.
Whatever the Empire touches, it destroys. I can't defend the Republic's choice to keep a secret prison here, but that doesn't make this right.
It looks as if the Empire's begun the excavation without me. Heh. Little archaeologist humor there. That breach will lead us to the Republic prison, or what's left of it.
Now this is a prison break. Think I'm gonna like this planet.
This is where the first breakout occurred. These people are desperate, and violent.
A fine perimeter, though it lacks the elegance of Shadow Town. Don't you think?
There's the breach in the prison defenses. It must've all started here.
There's the breach. Our only way in... and maybe our only way out.
Heck of a place the Republic's set up here. Wonder if they've got anyone I know.
Subtle entrance. Fifty kilos of detonite, easy, or bomber strike maybe.
Empire people make super big hole over there!
Did I ever tell you I have a fear of being buried in a tunnel cave-in?
We could easily be flanked in there. I'll cover our rear, make sure no one follows us in.
More trouble awaits, master. There are hostile thoughts inside this tunnel.
Feeling jittery over here. Think I'm in withdrawal--let's kill something soon.
Could be more Gand in there. Hate those buggish freaks. Time to exterminate them all.
We enter now, kill all within, come out the other side with the stench of death.
Tread lightly, little Sith. We are not among friends.
I wonder what the Republic's using this tunnel for? And how all these aliens got here.
This facility's much larger than I imagined. And that tunnel? What was the Republic doing here?
A tunnel! Who knows what secrets it may hold. I hate to rush a job, but there's just so much here!
Spent some time in holding, but jail time is for chumps. Knew a lot of people in labor camps, though--fought each other more than the guards.
Stop a moment. A thousand scents, a thousand songs... there's so much life here. And the Republic made it a prison.
I had a Minder friend once who was captured by the SIS. I always assumed he'd been killed, but I hope he was imprisoned someplace like this. He'd have enjoyed the view.
This place is fantastic. It shouldn't be a prison at all, it should be... I don't know. A garden for the Sith, a jewel for the Empire.
This is definitely not what I was thinking when I heard "prison planet." I expected durasteel walls and deflector shields, not fields of flowers and trees.
Here's hoping this is a shortcut and not, say, some dead-end cell block we're going to get trapped in for the rest of our lives.
Cross quickly, we're exposed out here. Good shooter could pick us off easy.
Ooh, look! Blizz can see far down!
That must be where they keep the really bad criminals. Guess that means we're going in.
The deeper we go, the more difficult our extraction. My calculations are growing more unsure.
What was so terrible they needed to put it behind a river of lava?
Murderers abound--I sense genocidal thoughts in there, sadistic cravings, unbelievable lust for vengeance and destruction. Yum.
Love to visit strange new worlds, meet strange new people, kill them.
They can't build a cell that will hold us!
The fire beneath us, no place to go but forward.
A particularly sadistic captain once tried to make me walk on hot coals, but I think I'll pass on swimming in magma. Let's stay away from the edge.
Be careful. We're entering the most ancient and most secure part of the old prison. Who knows what horrors the Rakata locked away.
You don't flinch at danger, do you? Not that I'm frightened. Ahead lies maximum security and things unseen by any but the Rakata.
New security zone. But you feel that? Soak up the steam and enjoy it.
Heat, in the middle of an ice world. It's extraordinary.
A crossing point between security zones. Somehow, I don't think this is where they keep the non-violent offenders.
New security zone, new types of prisoners. Not that they'll be any friendlier.
I see why they called it "the tomb." Reminds me of all those old ruins I saw on Dromund Kaas.
Why do I let you drag me to these places? I say we sit right here and wait until Zale comes back out. If he doesn't, who's going to know?
"The tomb," huh? No joke from the look of it.
Look, boss! Rock-river!
This place keeps getting more surreal. I guess we're headed into the cave beneath the subterranean giant tree?
Sophisticated alien technology built this place. There's no telling what we may face.
This tree gives off a powerful essence. I've never felt anything like it before.
There are powerful secrets locked away here. I say we pry them out, painfully.
I've fought on dozens of bizarre worlds on the fringes of the galaxy. Never seen nothing like this.
We feel an ancient power in this place.
The grave of a dead empire.
You got a way of finding the craziest places, Sith. Who knew this place was under a tree. Let's just hope the folks who built this place are all dead, but I'm keeping my blaster handy just in case.
These Rakata buildings make me uncomfortable. They ruled the galaxy, and then they just disappeared.
Is this truly Rakata-built? I can't believe it. I can't--I'm sorry. I need a moment.
Cripes. It's like the prison runs straight to the core... you could lock half the galaxy in here.
The nest remembers a place like this, long ago and far away. The creation of an ancient people... but not more ancient than us.
Such advanced technology. Such fine detail. The Empire is a great civilization, but we still have much to learn.
I've never heard of anything like this, sir. Not beyond stories--Chiss fables about ancient species... be careful.
I--I think this place is Rakatan. They had some galaxy-spanning empire that makes the Sith's look like they're playing around. Seriously ancient.
I don't say this often, but whatever valuables are down here can stay. Let's just bug out while we can, all right?
Path wasn't walked for a long time, until recently. Should've left it undisturbed.
Boss know why people put funny heads on statues?
Energy generator station = providing power to prison sector
Belsavis would be beautiful if it wasn't for all this ugly technology. The psychotic criminals don't help.
Maybe I should guard that energy station for a while. It'd be safer, wouldn't it?
These energy stations have been left undefended. That's poor tactical planning.
The Republic placed too much faith in its technology. This shield generator could not withstand the Empire's might.
Cannot trust shields. Better to rely on own strength and skill.
An oscillating shield network. Good luck to any prisoner who gets tangled up in that.
What's shielding the shield generator?
Their shield generators better be more reliable than the ones we had on Hoth. Blasted things blew a fuse every other day.
Those shield generators are the only thing keeping the Empire from taking over this place completely.
We must all defend the shield generators.
I hear the Empire's been hitting power generators all over this area. Probably wouldn't hurt to discourage that.
An unsecured power facility. Typical Republic incompetence. This is why the Empire will win.
I've got a bunch of old power packs back on the ship that need recharging. Knew I shoulda brought them with me....
Shield generators are still in one piece, at least. The Imps haven't smashed everything yet.
These shield generators appear to still be functional. We're fortunate that Imperial commandos haven't destroyed them.
Republic shield generators--the finest workmanship available! Particle field bulwarks for freedom!
I never knew the Republic had a place like this. And I thought regular prison sounded rough....
This world takes a strange path through history: known, then unknown; remembered, then forgotten.
T7 = detecting evidence of Imperial forces // Jedi = be prepared
So much for keeping the bad guys locked up. Let's hope the prisoners who used to be here were just greedy Senators.
Can't imagine why anybody would want to bust out of such a nice place. Are those turrets still working?
Whatever happened here was over long before we arrived. The Empire knew exactly what it was doing when it came through.
The Empire's plan of attack is to free as many prisoners as possible. Republic forces are easily confused by the chaos.
Republic cages. This is justice, Herald?
Throwing away the key wasn't enough. Freedom will out.
Republic got sloppy. Should have been best-defended positions on the planet.
Hey, yell if you see any good graffiti.
I don't figure this cell block should be wide open like that, do you?
We will find no one good down there.
You spend more time deliberately running into prisons than anyone I know....
The Empire has already been here. No telling how many prisoners they've released. This will be interesting.
Hello down there? Any bad people home? No? All right, we're leaving. Think they bought it?
Let's hope most of the prisoners have made a run for it. Anyone held here is bound to be tough.
We should be on our guard, sir. The occupants of these prisons are extremely dangerous.
If these prisoners refuse to serve their mandated sentences, then they can face summary justice! Let them come!
Let's keep our eyes open, huh? Anybody they locked up in a place like this isn't gonna be too friendly.
A path leading here is a path of violence and crimes beyond counting. Yuun advises caution.
Alert! // T7 = detecting large + hostile predators nearby
Those are some awfully big prison cells. Maybe we don't want to know what lives here....
Check out the size of these prison cells. What are they keeping here, rancors?
Any prisoner requiring this much security will take maximum firepower to bring down. I'll be ready.
The things imprisoned here should not have been released. The Empire's forces have gone mad.
Many cages. So many points lost.
Imagine being trapped here, surrounded by heinous criminals--bruhh.
Wish we'd had a few cells like these for Imperial prisoners.
Maximum security. Nothing to do but count snowflakes and think.
Those busted-open cells look even worse than the last batch. You ever get the feeling we're headed in the opposite direction of safe?
Bowdaar smells strange things here. Be wary.
The comm channels are full of Republic soldiers yelling to send more troops to this cell block. That can't be good.
Look at the size of those cells. I cannot wait to meet these prisoners.
Listen up, whatever ugly and large prisoners live here! I am a Jedi. Do not make me or my equally powerful friend hurt you!
I wonder how deep this place goes. It's just one prison block after another.
This complex seems to have no end. Prison block after prison block, with no end in sight.
The size and complexity of this prison is truly amazing! A true feat of Republic ingenuity!
More prison blocks. Someday, you're going to run out of nasty places to drag me along to.
This space reverberates with memories and thoughts of vengeance too terrible to speak.
Prison technology = advanced + unknown
It's cold here--almost like the Force has been drained out of the place. The only presence here is death.
Anything called the World Razer needs to stay down in its hole--forever.
Some weapons should never be used. This World Razer is one of them.
Do you feel it? There is vast destructive power here. It's intoxicating.
Something sleeps here.
Jedi, I can't help noticing the size of that vault.
That vault's too big. Something's wrong.
Just what kind of inmate needs a vault that huge?
Don't know what this World Razer is, but there's no such thing as a monster that eats planets. Is there?
Bowdaar's battle skills are tested against the World Razer. Good!
Would it really be so awful if this World Razer destroyed Belsavis? After we left, obviously.
Battles like this are the reason I stay with you. Not many Mandalorians can say they've faced the World Razer.
Wouldn't you rather have the Wookiee with you right now? I mean, he's taller--and he probably enjoys fighting things called the World Razer.
Whatever's behind that door, it's not good. Let's stay sharp, huh?
We cannot know with certainty what we'll face inside. I think a cautious approach might be advisable, sir.
Whatever danger may hide in these depths, it is no match for Havoc Squad! Onward!
Seriously? This is where we're going? Are you crazy?
Yuun can see the anguish of millions laid here. The regrets of deaths beyond counting.
Praise: Sometime a giant hole is the most effective means of entry.
Alert: Beware the possibility of ambush by undesirables. It is how I would use this terrain.
Opinion: The security protocols for this level are quite thorough.
Approval: We could liquidate undesirables here indefinitely. How delightful.
Judgment: A linked series of energy generators? Careless planning. No wonder the Empire invaded so easily.
Witticism: I must remember to thank the Empire for releasing all these prisoners. I will not be bored.
Estimation: Given the size of these prison cells, I predict we will encounter exciting new troublemakers.
Praise: One must admire the commitment to deleting troublemakers that is inherent in a name like "World Razer."
